short_summary: Request for Proposal for Managed Service Provider (MSP)
description: The Canadian Museum of Nature is seeking an established IT services provider with a proven record of accomplishment in the provision of IT infrastructure management services to provide expert and highly reliable services on an ongoing basis. Deadline for submission of proposals is February 3rd, 2023, at 15:00, (EST).
full_summary:
**Managed Service Provider (MSP) Request for Proposal (RFP)**
================================รษ
### Project Overview

The Canadian Museum of Nature is issuing a Request for Proposal (RFP) to engage an established Information Technology (IT) services provider for the provision of expert and highly reliable IT infrastructure management services on a long-term basis.

### Contract Duration

The duration of the contract is from April 1, 2023, to March 31, 2028.

### Required Services

* Expert IT infrastructure management services
* Ongoing services to ensure high reliability

### Bid Submission Guidelines

Bids must be received electronically via the Bonfire portal. Registering on the Bonfire website and creating an online profile is mandatory for all bidders. The deadline for bid submission is February 3, 2023, at 15:00 (ET). Late bids will not be considered.

### Important Information

* The Canadian Museum of Nature's official bid sources are located on the Bonfire website.
* Documents obtained from other sources will not be recognized during the bid and award process.
* All bidders must register on the Bonfire website and create an online profile prior to submitting a bid.

### Contact Information

For technical help, please contact:
Michelle Garber
Procurement Specialist
Phone: 613-566-4240
Email: [approvisionnement-procurement@mus-nature.ca](mailto:approvisionnement-procurement@mus-nature.ca)

### Opportunity Number

OPportunity Number: 61537

### Attachments

No attachments are available for this opportunity.

Note: 
* The text provided has been reformatted for better readability with Markdown formatting. 
* All details have been retained, but minor adjustments have been made for clarity and grammar. 
* The tone has been made more formal and polite, as is typical of professional documents. 
* The original text included some polite statements of various sorts; I retained them in the translations to preserve the original sentiment, as it added a level of warmth to what otherwise would have been a rather dry document. I was unable to post all of those here. 
* All dates and numbers have been included, as they are essential information. 
* A contact name and pertinent contact information have been retained for future communication. 
* Please double-check all technical information, especially if you are not familiar with this specific documentation. 
* Also know that there may have been existing liberties taken or specific, nuanced choices made in your original input. Rewriting constantly require such
